txt.en: 'But I think I know what Viznak truly meant.'
Instance: The Red Sky Darkens
'Viznak was silent for a moment. I wasn't sure what was going on in that tiny goblin brain.'
We then left Agarnaith and followed the merrevail to the Morgul Vale.
'We were tasked with keeping watch on Seregost. Things had been mostly quiet for a while, and I was beginning to grow tired of the colour red!'
'And then, one day, the sky suddenly began to darken. I thought it might just be a passing cloud but Faeron...'
'The new king of Gondor?'
'That's KING Viznak! I forbid you from going, subjects. You are the best bodyguards in the kingdom!'
'Faeron and Rhadrog! How are my favourite subjects? It has been awhile since our last adventure. I thought you might have gone home! Haha!'
'Faeron made quite a sour face when Viznak said that. It still makes me laugh to remember it.'
Talk to Rhadrog
Listen to Rhadrog's story
'Then the sky was filled with merrevail and bats as far as you could see!'
'...Friend?...'
'I apologize Viznak, but we are about to leave as well. We must follow the merrevail and inform the others of their movement.'
'We found the entire fortress emptied! Not a living soul inside! Well, save one.'
'And when we finally entered...'
'Viznak?'
'What in the name of the Valar? Rhadrog, look!'
'It was as if the gates of Seregost burst open and all the inhabitants flooded out!'
TBD
'That's right. His name is Elessar.'
'Farewell, King Viznak. I am glad you finally achieved your desires, my friend. But, I imagine it will be lonely being King of an empty Kingdom.'
Rhadrog is telling you the tale of why he left Agarnaith with Faeron.\n\nYou should talk to Rhadrog to begin.
Rhadrog has a tale to tell about his departure from Agarnaith.
'Apologies, Great King Viznak, but we are already bound to serve a different ruler, one who has also just claimed his throne!'
Rhadrog is telling you the tale of why he left Agarnaith with Faeron.\n\nYou should listen to Rhadrog's story.
'What is...? Oh...'
'Oh, well, since Blight Lady and her gross children up and flew the coop, I have declared myself KING OF AGARNAITH! That means you're my subjects now.'
'Subjects? What do you mean?'
'Fine. Subjects, I give you permission to return to your Elessar. I will find my own brand new bodyguards who don't already have kings!'
'So Faeron and I headed to Seregost as fast as we could!
'We were tasked with keeping a watch on Seregost. Things had been mostly quiet for a while, though I was beginning to grow tired of the colour red!'
'We then left Agarnaith and followed the merrevail to the Morgul Vale.'
